newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony says discussing JSkyB move, no specifics yet.
newsitem.headline: Sony says discussing JSkyB move, no specifics yet.

text.p: Sony Corp said on Friday it was discussing a possible tie-up in Japanese digital broadcasting with media tycoon Rupert Murdoch, whose News Corp is a partner in the television venture.
But nothing specific has yet been decided between them about Sony's possible participation in the venture, Japan Sky Broadcasting Co, a Sony spokesman said.
Japan's Softbank Corp is already a partner in JSkyB, along with News Corp.
"It is true that we hope to do business together and we are discussing it with Mr Murdoch," the company spokesman said.

"But nothing has yet been decided. We don't know the degree of the possible cooperation yet," he said, adding that he did not know if the possible tie-up would include equity participation by Sony in JSkyB.
The Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Friday that Sony hopes to take a one-third stake in JSkyB.
Softbank said earlier on Friday that it and Sony were positively considering the possibility of Sony participating in JSkyB.
